meanings.sent1: The teacher was frustrated by the student's constant illogic in solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: The illogic of his argument was evident to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The illogic of trying to fit a square peg into a round hole was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her stable job and join a traveling circus was pure illogic.
meanings.sent5: The illogic of the conspiracy theory made it hard to take seriously.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being illogical.
meanings.sent1: His essay was filled with so much illogic that it was hard to follow his train of thought.
meanings.sent2: The illogic of her actions left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The illogic of wearing a winter coat in the middle of summer was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The illogic of her decision to swim with sharks was both terrifying and fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The illogic of the plan made it clear that it was doomed to fail.
